revised_title: Chalk Stratum Water Supply in London: Observations and Experiments
tldr: The author, John Dickinson, studied the supply of water from the chalk stratum in the London area. He observed the influence of various factors on the natural outflow of subterranean water through springs and rivers. Dickinson also experimented with a method to drain off water artificially, which could potentially affect the flow of rivers and springs. He concluded that the season of rainfall plays a significant role in the supply of these springs, and that artificial drainage could be possible.
